Sunhawk walked to the CR chamber and allowed the bots to suit him 
with an appropriate hawk mode.  HE steped out revealing beutiful, 
almost golden feathers as he let out the cry of a hawk followed by 
his own voice.

Sunhawk:  Sunhawk Maximize.

He transformed back into himself.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> He sees the the external sensore were brough back. He connects some 
wires, fixing the internal sensors. He gets up, brushing himself 
off. "Hmm, organic beast modes will help. As for the rest of us who 
prefer mechanical modes, we'll have to inselate ourselves with the 
same technology."He checks the sensors."Damn! The ship looks like 
slag. But could have been worse, we could have crashed on Quintessa, 
or into Unicron."
> He laughed at the joke only he, and maybe history buffs, would get.
> 
> {Talos}
> Deck 2, CR Chamber room
> 
> Talos had moved through the damaged ship and ascended the stairs to 
deck two where the main generators and CR chambers were located. 
After recieving Sunhawks and Hot Rod's reports he nodded before 
moving to a communications hub that wasn't sparking and turned on 
ship wide broadcasting, "Sensors have detected massive energon 
readings outside the ship, all personnel should report to the CR 
Chamber bay for alterate form protection, do not stray far from the 
ship before you have done this."
> 
> Closing the channel he moved to a console and began typing, on the 
top of the ship a hatch slid open freeing an extending pole that 
began scanning the surrounding area for compatible forms. After 
several seconds the machine stayed at a low hum holding a list of 
available alternate forms.
> 
> Entering one of the CR chambers he let the nanobots change his 
casing to more suit the transformation to beast mode. When the pod 
opened again Talos stepped out in his mammoth form. "Talos, 
MAXIMIZE!" He spoke as his body adjusted back to it's robotic form. 
Opening the comm to the bridge again he spoke, "Might want to repair 
that destroyed viewing portal there guys, the damage has probably 
rendered the bridges protective fields offline or at least unstable 
though from the time frame I'm guessing unstable so be careful don't 
want you guys slipping into stasis lock..."
